name: Introduction to Political Science
description: This course introduces students to the major theories, concepts, and debates in the field of political science

name: Introduction to Public Policy
description: This course provides an overview of the field of public policy, including its history, frameworks, and current debates

name: Policy Analysis and Program Evaluation
description: This course provides an introduction to the methods of policy analysis and program evaluation, including quantitative and qualitative methods

name: Public Policy Processes and Institutions
description: This course examines the relationships between public policy processes and institutions, including the role of the media, public opinion, and interest groups in the policy-making process

name: Advanced Public Policy Topics
description: This course explores specific policy topics in detail, such as environmental policy, health care policy, or poverty and inequality policy
